pr_title: Expose histogram envoy stats methods to interface & engines

timeline.bodyText: This will be used in a follow-up PR for the actual interface that clients will use to record histogram stats.
timeline.author: donyu

timeline.message: update interfaces again to separate timer and generic
uncommit temp bazel change

kotlin and swift lint

Signed-off-by: Don Yu <donyu@lyft.com>

fix ordinal

Signed-off-by: Don Yu <donyu@lyft.com>

fix ordinal

Signed-off-by: Don Yu <donyu@lyft.com>

timeline.bodyText: it's probably worth documenting (as a comment in this pr) the reason of pushing HistogramUnit enum to this layer (instead of keeping in below jni)
timeline.author: jingwei99
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -72,5 +73,15 @@ int runWithConfig(EnvoyConfiguration envoyConfiguration, String logLevel,
    */
   int recordGaugeSub(String elements, int amount);
 
+  /**
+   * Add another recorded amount to the histogram with the given string of elements.
+   *
+   * @param elements Elements of the histogram stat.
+   * @param value Amount to record as a new value for the histogram distribution.
+   * @param unitMeasure the unit of measurement (e.g. milliseconds, bytes, etc.)
+   * @return A status indicating if the action was successful.
+   */
+  int recordHistogramValue(String elements, int value, HistogramUnit unitMeasure);

replies.bodyText: I updated to hide the enum at the JNI layer. I think it's cleaner to have 2 separate implementations here.
replies.author: donyu
